title: Basic R Programming
text:
ST 558
Ella Gruchacz

Task 1: Basic Vector Practice
Create two vectors, one for blood pressure pre treatment and one post treatement.

pre_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)

Assign names to each vector element.

names(pre_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(post_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")

Create a vector storing the difference in BP measurement between post treatment and pre treatment, and calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients.

bp_diff <- post_bp - pre_bp
mean(bp_diff)

[1] -5.65


Find which subjects had a positive change, their BP was lower after treatment.

which(bp_diff < 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Save the difference in BP measurements for subjects that experienced a positive change.

bp_dec <- bp_diff[bp_diff < 0]

Find the average difference in BP for subjects that experienced a positive change.

mean(bp_dec)

[1] -10.6




Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice
Create a data frame corresponding to the data patient, pre_bp, post_bp, and diff_bp.

patients <- names(pre_bp)
bp_data <- data.frame(patients, pre_bp, post_bp, bp_diff, row.names = NULL)

Return the rows of the data frame where the diff_bp column is negative.

bp_data[bp_data$bp_diff < 0,]

     patients pre_bp post_bp bp_diff
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6
4   Subject_4    126     122      -4
6   Subject_6    132     122     -10
7   Subject_7    132     123      -9
8   Subject_8    129     126      -3
9   Subject_9    134     126      -8
10 Subject_10    139     129     -10
13 Subject_13    127     120      -7
14 Subject_14    135     114     -21
15 Subject_15    133     121     -12
16 Subject_16    128     120      -8
17 Subject_17    147     128     -19
18 Subject_18    138     120     -18
19 Subject_19    140     133      -7
20 Subject_20    132     115     -17


Create a new column of the data frame corresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not.

bp_data$less_120 <- bp_data$post_bp < 120

Print the data frame.

knitr::kable(bp_data)

Task 3: List Practice
Recreate the last data frame with new data.

placebo <- data.frame(
                      patients = paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_"), 
                      pre_trt = c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130),
                      post_trt = c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120,124))
placebo$trt_diff <- placebo$post_trt - placebo$pre_trt
                      
placebo$less_120 <- placebo$trt_diff < 120

Create a list of two data frames.

exper <- list(treatment = bp_data, placebo = placebo)

Access the first element in three ways.

$ operator


exper$treatment

     patients pre_bp post_bp bp_diff less_120
1   Subject_1    120     127       7    FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6    FALSE

In one line of code, access the pre_bp column of the placebo data frame.

exper$placebo$pre_trt

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131
[20] 130
